Wow! Angelina Jordan (8): "What a Difference a Day Make"
55KLikes
11,653,492Views
2014Jul 3
Amazing! 8 year old Angelina Jordan, winner of Norway\`s Got Talent 2014, performs Dinah Washingtons "What a Difference a Day Made" on the opening show of TV 2 singalong summer hit "Allsang på grensen" on Thursday June 3rd 2014. The song was written in Spanish by María Grever, a Mexican songwriter, in 1934. Originally, the song was known as "Cuando vuelva a tu lado" ("When I Return to Your Side"). The song is also known in English as "What a Diff'rence a Day Makes", as popularized by Dinah Washington. The English lyrics were written by Stanley Adams, and was played by Harry Roy & his Orchestra. It was published in late 1934. The most successful early recording, in 1934, was by the Dorsey Brothers. (ref Wikipedia) Se programmet her:  More info on Halden, host town of the Allsang TV 2 show:  Angelinas winning performance at Norway\`s Got Talent     • Video]

Since then she has worked to raise money on behalf of environmental causes and various children's charities. She always performs , after befriending a young shoeless girl and giving her shoes to her. Jordan later wrote a book about the experience, _&action=edit&redlink=1 "Mellom to hjerter (Between Two Hearts) (page does not exist)")_.
Jordan has released multiple digital singles and EPs, and one full-length album called _It's Magic_. She appeared on the first season of __ in 2016, and the second season of __ in 2020, where her cover version of  "Queen (band)") "" brought her much attention.
Jordan has lived in the United States since 2018. In August 2020, it was announced that she has signed with .] Her first single under that label, "Million Miles", was released in November ...[Content truncated]

content.content:
28 September 2020, 14:39 | Updated: 14 May 2021, 16:04
!
Home video footage from the 2015 documentary 'Amy' shows the young star's amazing natural talent. Picture: Youtube/Film4/Universal Music/A24
An old home video of a 14-year-old Amy Winehouse shows how spectacular her singing voice was from the very beginning.
Footage of a teenage  from Southgate, north London shows the future star singing 'Happy Birthday' to her friends as they lark around with a camera.
The video shows four girls saying they are "the only ones left" at the end of a 14th birthday party and introducing themselves on camera, before they all start singing to birthday girl, named as Lauren Gilbert.
**See more:** 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The video then pans to Amy Winehouse, who stands up and blasts the final lines of 'Happy Birthday' in an incredibly powerful voice, one that would become so distinctive across the world in just a few years time.
!

[Content truncated]...
=====================================================================================================
The clip was released in celebration of the upcoming 20th anniversary of the late singer's 2004 debut album, "Frank."
By 
### 
#### More Stories by Gil Kaufman
*   
*   
*   
01/23/2024
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   
*   (whatsapp://send?text=Amy%20Winehouse%20Takes%20a%20Hotel%20Stroll%20in%20New%20%E2%80%98In%20My%20Bed%E2%80%99%20Lyric%20Video%20Featuring%20Previously%20UnseenFootage%20-%20https://www.billboard.com/music/pop/amy-winehouse-new-in-my-bed-lyric-video-unseen-footage-1235587030/)
*   
*   Print this article
*   
*   
!
Amy Winehouse "In My Bed" Courtesy Photo
 takes a casual stroll through a chic hotel in the new official lyric video for the late singer’s 2004 song “In My Bed.” The visual is comprised of previously unseen footage from the original video that was released on April 5, 2004.
### Related
 ### Marisa Abela Mesmerizes in First Amy Winehouse ‘Back to Black’ Biopic Trailer 01/11/2024]
The jazzy R&B track was featured on Winehouse’s debut full-length album, _Frank_, and the lyric clip finds the then-20-year-old singer striking poses on the hotel front desk in a flowered dress, with her soon-to-be-signature sky-high beehive hairdo not in evidence in favor of a shoulder-length down do. In other footage Winehouse grabs a mic in front of her live band and sings, “Like two ships passing in the night/ In the night, in the night/ Want the same thing where we lay/ Otherwise mine’s a different way.”
The video refresh — the original was directed by Paul Gore — comes as _Frank_ has been reissued in a limited-edition 2LP . The LP features the singles “Take The Box,” “Stronger Than Me,” F–k Me Pumps” and “In My Bed,” and has the original sleeve imagery, plus additional images by Valerie Phillips from the original album photoshoot.
### Trending on Billboard
Winehouse died on July 23, 2011 at age 27 of an accidental alcohol overdose after years of substance use struggles. Her life will be honored in the upcoming Sam Taylor-Johnson-directed biopic _Back to Black_ starring _Industry_‘s Marisa Abela. The Studio Canal film written by Matt Greenhalgh (_Nowhere Boy_) was made with the support of the Winehouse estate, Universal Music Group and Sony Music Publishing and will feature a number of the “Rehab” singer’s most beloved hits.
_Back to Black_ opens in the U.S....[Content truncated]

QA.Question: What evidence exists of Angelina Jordan's performances at age eight compared to Amy Winehouse's singing at age ten?
QA.Answer: Angelina Jordan's performances at age eight are well-documented, particularly highlighted by her winning audition on "Norway's Got Talent" in 2014, where she showcased her exceptional vocal abilities by singing "What a Difference a Day Makes." This performance took place on July 3, 2014, when she was celebrated for captivating the audience with her talent at a young age. Additionally, her biography notes that she was born on January 10, 2006, which places her performance achievements firmly at the age of eight during this period. In contrast, Amy Winehouse did not have publicly available performances at the age of ten. The earliest known footage of Winehouse singing comes from when she was 14 years old, during a friend's birthday party, where she performed "Happy Birthday." This indicates that there is no evidence of her performing in front of an audience at the age of ten or capturing the same level of public attention or acclaim as seen with Angelina Jordan. Thus, we can conclude that there is substantial evidence of Angelina Jordan's talent displayed at age eight through various performances, while there is a lack of evidence for any significant performances by Amy Winehouse until she was older. This comparison illustrates a clear distinction in the visibility and recognition of their talents at those respective ages.
